kaninator.mechanics
Class DynamicObject

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.mechanics.DynamicObject

public class DynamicObject
extends java.lang.Object

This is the class responsible for movement in the internal 3-Dimensional coordinate systems and animations. Everything that moves and/or is animated contains a DynamicObject. DynamicObjects can perform collision checks on each other.

Author:
phedman

Constructor Summary
DynamicObject(java.util.ArrayList<Animation> _animations, double _radius)
          Creates a DynamicObject from a set of animations, the radius is used to specify the collision checks.

Constructor Detail

DynamicObject

public DynamicObject(java.util.ArrayList<Animation> _animations,
                     double _radius)
Creates a DynamicObject from a set of animations, the radius is used to specify the collision checks.

Parameters:
_animations - The animations which will be displayed when the DynamicObject is rendered.
_radius - The radius to be used in collision detection.
Method Detail

collide

public boolean collide(DynamicObject other)
Checks against a collision with another DynamicObject

Parameters:
other - The DynamicObject to check against.
Returns:
True if the objects collide, otherwise false.

setHeightOffset

public void setHeightOffset(double _offset)
Set a height offset in order to fool the depth checking algorithms in Camera.

Parameters:
_offset - The offset to be added to the height of the object.
See Also:
Camera

setHeight

public void setHeight(double height)
Sets the height coordinate of the dynamic object.

Parameters:
height - The new height for the object.

setPos

public void setPos(double _x,
                   double _y)
Sets the position for the DynamicObject in the internal 3-Dimensional coordinate system.

Parameters:
_x - The new x coordinate.
_y - The new Y coordinate.

setPosOffset

public void setPosOffset(double _offset_x,
                         double _offset_y)
Set a position offset in order to fool the depth checking algorithms in Camera.

Parameters:
_offset_x - The offset to be added to the x coordinate of the object.
_offset_y - The offset to be added to the y coordinate of the object.
